title: Understanding Entropy
text: Entropy is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system. When a system becomes more disordered, its entropy increases.

title: Consider the Initial State
text: Initially, the gas is confined to a small part of the container. This means the gas molecules are restricted in their movement.

title: Consider the Final State
text: When the container is opened, the gas molecules spread out to fill the entire container. This increases the randomness of the system.

title: Comparing Initial and Final States
text: Compare the initial state (confined gas) with the final state (gas spread out). Which state has more disorder?

title: Predicting Entropy Change
text: Since the gas molecules are more spread out in the final state, the system's entropy has increased. Therefore, the entropy change is positive.
